title: Ursula donates books, laptops, sanitizers as birthday presents
text:
Politics | 21 October 2015 23:00 CET Ursula donates books, laptops, sanitizers as birthday presents By GNA 
Accra, Oct. 20, GNA - Mrs Ursula Owusu Ekuful, Member of Parliament (MP) for Ablekuma West on Tuesday donated assorted items including 10,000 exercise books and 30 laptop computers to the Okpoti Cluster of Schools in Dansoman. 
The MP also presented to the schools cartons of soft drinks and 1,000 pieces of Carex hand sanitizer from PZ Cussons. 
Mr Ekuful made the presentation to the schools with a population of over 5,000 pupils and students as part of her 51st birthday celebration. 
Mrs Ekuful said: 'I didn't find the need to throw a birthday party and have fun with friends when I could use the money for a more meaningful activity to impact lives of these school children'. 
She said education is what has taken her this far, so it is her primary objective to promote teaching and learning, particularly that of the girl child. 
She counselled the female pupils not to be intimidated by the challenges they might be going through but rather be focused and work hard towards achieving their dreams. 
'Whatever it is that you have in you, try to bring it out whether good or bad so that praises or criticisms from people will sharpen and strengthen you, because females are major contributors to the development of a nation' she said. 
The MP advised the pupils to take good care of the donated items to encourage other bodies to offer similar assistance to the schools. 
Mrs Ekuful also assured members of the Dansoman special school of her collaboration with the Accra Metropolitan Assembly to provide them with a better structure, furniture and learning materials. 
She also pledged to provide sets of dual desks and help solve other related problems in the schools, such as Akuaku and Bishop John Daly Anglican Basic schools. 
She urged them to pay serious attention to hygiene by washing their hands before eating or using sanitizers to prevent germ infections. 
Mr Kwaku Mensah, Director of Finance and Administration, at the Accra Metro Education Directorate, who received the items expressed gratitude to the legislator.
